au.edu.federation.caliko.utils

Class Colour4f

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.utils.Colour4f

  • public class Colour4f
extends Object
    Class to represent a RGBA colour as four floating point values.

    The r, g, b and a properties of the class are publicly accessible for direct access, but constructors and the 'set' method clamp the colour components to the valid range 0.0f to 1.0f. Setting colour component values outside of this range may result in undefined behaviour.

    Version:
    0.9 - 29/12/2015
    Author:
    Al Lansley

    • Constructor Detail

      • Colour4f

        public Colour4f()
        Default constructor.

        The constructed Colour4f has it's RGBA components set to default values of 1.0f, which equates to white at full opacity.

      • Colour4f

        public Colour4f(Colour4f source)
        Copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        source - The source Colour4f object to copy the component values from.

      • Colour4f

        public Colour4f(float[] sourceValues)
        Array Constructor.

        If the array size is not 4, then an IllegalArgument exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        sourceValues - The array of floats to copy the values from.

      • Colour4f

        public Colour4f(float red,
                float green,
                float blue,
                float alpha)
        Float Constructor.

        The valid range of each component is 0.0f to 1.0f inclusive, any values outside of this range will be clamped.

        Parameters:
        red - The red component of this colour.
        green - The green component of this colour.
        blue - The blue component of this colour.
        alpha - The alpha component of this colour.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(Colour4f source)
        Set the RGBA values of this Colour4f object from a source Colour4f object.

        Source values are clamped to the range 0.0f..1.0f.

        Parameters:
        source - The source colour to set the values of this colour to.

      • set

        public void set(float red,
                float green,
                float blue,
                float alpha)
        Set the RGBA values of this Colour4f object from a red, green, blue and alpha value.

        Any values outside the range 0.0f..1.0f are clamped to the nearest valid value.

        Parameters:
        red - (float) The red component to set for this colour.
        green - (float) The green component to set for this colour.
        blue - (float) The blue component to set for this colour.
        alpha - (float) The alpha component to set for this colour.

      • addRGB

        public Colour4f addRGB(float red,
                       float green,
                       float blue)
        Add to the RGB components of this colour by the given amounts and return this modified colour for chaining.

        When adding, colour values are clamped to a maximum value of 1.0f.

        Parameters:
        red - The red component to add to this colour.
        green - The green component to add to this colour.
        blue - The blue component to add to this colour.
        Returns:
        This modified colour.

      • subtractRGB

        public Colour4f subtractRGB(float red,
                            float green,
                            float blue)
        Subtract from the RGB components of this colour by the given amounts and return this modified colour for chaining.

        When subtracting, colour values are clamped to a minimum value of 1.0f.

        Parameters:
        red - The red component to add to this colour.
        green - The green component to add to this colour.
        blue - The blue component to add to this colour.
        Returns:
        This modified colour.

      • lighten

        public Colour4f lighten(float amount)
        Lighten the RGB components of this colour by a given amount.

        Resulting colour components are clamped to the range 0.0f..1.0f.

        Parameters:
        amount - The value to add to each (RGB only) component of the colour.
        Returns:
        The 'lightened' colour with the amount added to each component.

      • darken

        public Colour4f darken(float amount)
        Darken the RGB components of this colour by a given amount.

        Resulting colour components are clamped to the range 0.0f..1.0f.

        Parameters:
        amount - The value to subtract from each (RGB only) component of the colour.
        Returns:
        The 'darkened' colour with the amount subtracted from each component.

      • toArray

        public float[] toArray()
        Return this colour as an array of four floats.
        Returns:
        This colour as an array of four floats.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Return a concise, human-readable description of the Colour4f object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • randomOpaqueColour

        public static Colour4f randomOpaqueColour()
        Return a random colour with an alpha value of 1.0f (i.e. fully opaque)
        Returns:
        The random opaque colour.
